content: autumn rose gloves by cissy tang @dotcardigan december 2023 autumn rose gloves is a simple fingerless glove pattern that uses one strand of fingering weight yarn held with one strand of silk-mohair yarn or other lace-weight yarn it s perfect for using up your leftover yarns after finishing a mohair sweater or a pair of socks the gloves have a double-folded hem and are finished with an i-cord edge increases for the thumb are done on the side seam for a clean and polished look materials 50g* fingering weight yarn sample knit in sandnes garn sunday #4236 25g* silk mohair or other lace-weight yarn sample knit in knitting for olive soft silk mohair in bordeaux 3 00mm us 2 5 double pointed needles long circular needles for magic loop or 9-inch circular needles stitch markers if desired tapestry needle for finishing *note that i used 40g of fingering weight yarn and 15g of silk mohair for the sample gloves gauge 28 stitches per 4 inches 10 cm row gauge may vary and instructions for length will be given in inches and cm size one size adult medium abbreviations k knit p purl m1r make 1 right m1l make 1 left k2tog knit 2 together ssk slip slip knit bor beginning of round pattern begins here cast on 48 stitches with both yarns held together using your preferred stretchy cast-on method i used the long tail cast-on join to begin knitting in the round being careful not to twist your work mark the bor if desired work in stockinette stitch knit every round until work measures 3 inches 8cm create double-fold hem fold the stockinette tube in half purl-sides together using your right needle find and pick up the stitch on the cast-on edge that corresponds with the first stitch of the round placing it onto the left needle knit the picked-up stitch and the stitch on its left together k2tog repeat this process with the next stitch and continue until you have picked up every stitch of the cast-on edge check your work periodically to ensure that you are picking up the correct corresponding stitch and that the work isn t becoming twisted you now have a double-fold hem *** continue in stockinette until work measures 3 inches 8cm thumb increases round 1 k1 m1l k to 1 stitch before bor marker m1r k1 2 stitches increased rounds 2 and 3 k all stitches repeat rounds 1-3 a total of 8 times 16 stitches increased next round knit to 8 stitches before bor marker put the next 16 stitches on hold either on a stitch holder or a piece of scrap yarn remove bor marker and place it between the current stitch and the next stitch *** work in stockinette until the work measures 3 inches 8cm from the thumb hole or your desired length i-cord bind-off once you have finished working your last round remove bor marker cast on 3 stitches using the knitted cast-on *knit the
